metadata.title: CVE-2018-5140 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Image for moz-icons can be accessed through the "moz-icon:" protocolthrough script in web content even when otherwise prohibited. This couldallow for information leakage of which applications are associated withspecific MIME types by a malicious page. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
